description: I've been attending [**Quantum Formalism**](https://quantumformalism.substack.com/) lectures taken by [*Bambordé Baldé*](https://twitter.com/zaikubalde) from Zaiku group. They're about the abstract math behind QC (Group theory et al.). I've applied as a moderator, so I'll be helping out people during the lecture.
I participated in the **Qiskit India Challenge** 2020 by IBM, along with a team of 5. We used EfficientSU2, ZZFeatureMap, and COBYLA to classify 4 and 9 from the MNIST dataset.

I've joined [**Quantum Universal Education**](https://fullstackquantumcomputation.tech/) (funded by unitary fund) as a **Qurator**. We'll be a sort of aggregation of articles/tutorials on QC-related concepts and projects.
I participated in the **Q# Coding Contest** Summer of 2020. It was decently hard for me. The problems also involved Q# Machine Learning libraries.

Finally after much fumbling around with setting up Q# environment and thinking too hard about simple problems only to realize that I was, infact, thinking much too hard, I've completed the Codeforces Q# Warm-up round.
I've been reading this draft paper of TLS1.3 w/ hybrid quantum keys by *Douglas Steblia* of U of Waterloo.
I've been learning Q# from Quantum Katas.
